speaker: Other Jerry:
dialouge: Out of my way!

speaker: Another Jerry:
dialouge: The factory tint setting is always too high!

speaker: Ship:
dialouge:
You have
arrived at Krombopulos Michael. Your destination is below.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: *dazed* All out of off-white Persians… *gets out of the ship and realizes he killed Krombopulos Michael* Oh man, wha-wh-wh-what have I done?! *picks up KM’s arm and the antimatter gun*

speaker: Gromflomite:
dialouge: (pointing a gun at Morty) Drop the gun!

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: You don’t understand! This guy was gonna kill someone!

speaker: Gromflomite:
dialouge: I guess that makes two of us. *fires up his weapon*

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: What are you doing Morty?! This is a Galactic Federation outpost! Look, I don’t have time to tell you my entire backstory, but Grandpa and government don’t get along!

speaker: Fart
dialouge: You saved my life!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: What?

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: Huh?! Are you Krombopulos Michael’s target? W-Wwwwhat’s your name?

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: My kind has no use for names. I communicate through what you call “Jessica’s feet.” No, “telepathy.”

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Oh, good job, Morty. Y-Y-Y-You killed my best customer but you saved a mind-reading fart!

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: I like this name, ‘Fart.’ Morty, would you kindly release me by pulling that lever to the left of my cell? I am in great pain.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Morty, don’t do it. (Morty walks toward the lever.) Morty… (Morty glances at Rick before pulling the lever. Alarms start to sound as Fart escapes his cell.) Morty, you idiot!

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: Oh crap, let’s get you outta here!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: We can’t get him outta here. He’s gaseous. He’s not gonna make it through a portal, Morty.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: *stomps past Rick* Well then I guess we’re all getting in the car! Right, uh…

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: Fart.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: No! Jus-j-j-just get in the car!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Morty, come on, I-I wanna go back to Blips and Chitz. I don’t wanna deal with this!

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: Y-You’ve been clear on the fact that you don’t wanna help, so just go away!

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: More are coming.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Screw this. I’m out.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: Oooh…! Come on, come on!

speaker: Gromflomite:
dialouge: Get out of the vehicle made of garbage or we will open fire!

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: *still trying to start the car* Oh no no no!

speaker: Gromflomite:
dialouge: Open fire!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Stupid-ass fart-saving carpet-store motherfucker! *shoves Morty out of the driver’s seat and takes the wheel* Move!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Wait, did you fuck with my seat settings?

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: More are coming.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: Rick!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Yeah, yeah. (He crashes the car into the Gromflomites before flying away from the outpost.)

speaker: Gearhead:
dialouge: Your geldon convertor is pretty dinged up.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: That’s ‘cause my grandson drives like a male Obavradian. Yeah, I said it. Some stereotypes are based in fact.

speaker: Gearhead:
dialouge: Actually, it’s because of years of neglect. You really need to respect your gears, Rick. To you, they’re just wheels with teeth, but in my culture, wars have been fought, entire—

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: *interrupts him* So I’ve heard. Just fix it. *to Morty* I don’t think the Gromflomites can track us now, but it looks like we’re gonna be here for awhile. *lowers voice* Or, ya know, if you still have that gun K. Michael dropped, we can finish the job and go home.

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: You do understand I’m telepathic, right?

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: I’m being polite.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: Rick, we’re taking him back where he belongs!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Yeah, where’s that? Are you going on a quest to find he who smelt it?

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: I came here accidentally through a wormhole located in what you call “get out of my head, Fart, I know you’re in here, la la la la—” No, in what you call the Promethean Nebula.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Oh great, just a hop, skip, and an 800 lightyear jump!

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: You know, you can leave any time you want, Rick.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: *walks away, muttering* Whatever you wanna do you little punk-ass little bitch…

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: Thank you, Morty. You are not like other carbon-based life forms. You put the value of all life above your own.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: That’s how things should be. It’s how they could be.

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: I could not agree more.

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: (singing over a montage formed from Morty’s imagination) The world can be one together / Cosmos without hatred / Stars like diamonds in your eyes. / The ground can be space (space, space, space, space) / With feet marching toward a peaceful sky. / All the moonmen want things their way / But we make sure they see the sun. / Goodbye, moonmen / You say goodbye, moonmen. / Goodby—

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
*holding a golf club* Shut the fuck up about moonmen! This isn’t a musical number. This
is a fucking operation, we gotta be cool and fucking lay low!

speaker: Random Jerry:
dialouge: *opens email and laughs* Duck, duck, birdie? (All Jerrys open emails and laugh.) Very funny!

speaker: Jerry:
dialouge: Here comes another funny…

speaker: Other Jerry:
dialouge: Hahaha! Oh, this place is great.

speaker: Jerry:
dialouge: I almost wish I could stay longer than one day.

speaker: Other Jerry:
dialouge: *suddenly serious* You just might.

speaker: Jerry:
dialouge: W-What do you mean?

speaker: Other Jerry:
dialouge: These are the Jerrys whose Ricks and Mortys never came back. (Forgotten Jerrys stand, sit, and lie around the room, generally looking despondent.) …They live here now.

speaker: Jerry:
dialouge: Uuuum…

speaker: Gear Anchor:
dialouge: No gear turnings as of yet in the curious case of these unidentified humanoid fugitives (An image of Rick and Morty in the car as Rick was adjusting the seat settings appears onscreen.) reportedly at large somewhere within the Gear System.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Son of a… *approaches Fart* Why were the Gromflomites holding you prisoner? What the fuck is so valuable about you?

speaker: Fart:
dialouge: I am no more valuable than life itself. However, I am able to alter the composition of atoms, like this. (An electric fuzz seems to go through the gaseous cloud and a lump of gold materializes, dropping to the ground beneath him.) That was oxygen. I added seventy-one protons to it.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: *picks up the gold* Ah, terrific. The fart that pooped gold. No wonder every cop in the system is lookin’ for us! *pockets gold* Any species that gets a hold of this thing is gonna use it to take over the galaxy. Do you know how inconvenient that’s gonna be to my work?

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Somebody dropped the dime on us. Gearhead… *turns around*

speaker: Gearhead:
dialouge: *pointing a gun at Rick* I’m sorry, Rick. The reward on your head is too high. And like you always say, you gotta look out for Number One.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Number One is

speaker: Gearhead:
dialouge: Friend? Do you even know my real name? It’s Revolio Clockberg Junior. I belong to an entire

speaker: Gearhead:
dialouge: No, not twigs!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Two things I wanna make clear to everybody in this room. Never betray me, and it’s time to go.

dialouge: Nobody move!

speaker: Gear Policeman #2:
dialouge: Oh my god.

speaker: Gear Policeman #1:
dialouge: Are those…?

speaker: Rick:
dialouge: Hey Morty, remember when you said selling a gun was as bad as pulling the trigger? How do you feel about all these people getting killed because of your choices?

dialouge:
I did
the right thing, Rick!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Tell
that to Gearhead’s gearsticles.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge:
You did
that!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Wrong! I’d
be playin’ Roy right now. At a certain point, my hands are tied, Morty.

dialouge:
*playing
poker with other Jerrys, sighs* I can’t believe Rick did this. This is the
eighth to the last straw.

dialouge: Ante up.

dialouge:
You
know what? *throws down cards* Screw it! I have a better gamble for your guys.

dialouge: If you want to leave, you can just go out the front door.

dialouge: You think we’re kept here against our will? That would be

dialouge:
But… If
you can leave, then why are you still here?

dialouge: Same reason as you. *looks to other Jerrys for confirmation* …We’re Jerrys.

speaker: Jerry:
dialouge:
I’m
leaving.

dialouge: Okay then, that was always allowed.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Morty,
take the wheel!

dialouge:
Whoa,
whoa!

dialouge: Whoa!

dialouge:
Geez,
dammit, Morty! Who taught you to fly this thing?! *laughs* Haha, I’m kidding, I

dialouge:
Um,
Rick!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Shit.
Well, I guess this is it.

dialouge:
Morty,
crack the window.

dialouge:
I wonder
why Greg is always so critical of my girlfriend.

dialouge:
Well…

dialouge:
Or does
he want

dialouge:
The
world can be one together / Cosmos without hatred / Stars like diamonds in your

dialouge:
Goodbye,
moonmen. / You say, goodbye, moonmen.

dialouge:
Goodbye,
moonmen… (Fart floats back in through the window and the song ends.) Alright,
let’s proceed.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Damn.
Can’t blame that on the dog. …Talk about silent but deadly. I-I’ve seen some

dialouge:
*not
amused* Are you done?

dialouge:
I’ll let
you know, Morty. Gone with the wind, am I right? If you don’t like that one,

Ga-ga
blahg blahg?

Agah
blahg-blah! (Jibberish continues as Jerry rushes away. Other aliens heckle

dialouge:
Hmm.
Hmm… *hesitantly makes to pet the creature, but its face suddenly splays out in

dialouge:
Agah
blahg blahg?

*holds
out cup* Agah blahg blah—

*wiping
goo off himself* Uhhh… Huhhh…. (Stumbles upon two fleshy alien creatures

dialouge: Hey, are you the one that left?

dialouge:
*single
nod*

dialouge: *suddenly less forlorn* Right? Who needs that?

dialouge:
Oh-ho,
not us!

dialouge:

dialouge:
Don’t worry. I treat Beth very well, and I do not
overstep my bounds with Morty. Every kid needs a dad, but there’s no replacing

dialouge:
Oh. Uh,
well, is there an Aux input?

dialouge: I tried that, but there’s two different colors.

dialouge: Uh… There’s two different colors.

dialouge:
The
wormhole is seventy of what you call ‘meters’ what you call ‘north’ of what you

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Fine.
Morty, take your fart to his hole and say your goodbyes. I’m gonna find some
fuel and take a biiiig fat Morty. (Morty gets out of the car.) That’s my new

dialouge:
Here it
is. This should take me back to my kind.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge:
I’m
gonna miss you, um, Fart. I’m really sorry your name became Fart.

speaker: Fart:
dialouge:
I will
be back soon, Morty.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: *excited* Really?

speaker: Fart:
dialouge:
After I
return to the others with this location, we will be back for your cleansing.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge:
Um…
Cleansing…?

speaker: Fart:
dialouge:
Carbon-based life is a threat to all higher life. To us, you are what you would
call a disease. Wherever we discover you, we cure it. You said yourself that
life must be protected even through sacrifice. (Morty, shocked and saddened,
begins to tear up.) You haven’t changed your mind about that. I can sense your
thoughts. Morty.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge:
*wipes
his eyes* Um… Before you go… Could you sing a… C-Could you sing for me again?

speaker: Fart:
dialouge:
Yes,
Morty. *approaches him as “Goodbye Moonmen” begins, again set to a sequence
formed from Morty’s imagination* Cosmos without hatred / Blinding stars of
cosmic light / Quasars shine through endless night / And everything is one in
the beauty / And now we say goodby—

dialouge:
Morty…
Why… Why?

speaker: Morty:
dialouge: Goodbye.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
So did you
guys make out a little bit? Is he gonna send you a postcard? (Morty wordlessly
enters the car.) Man, that guy hit the lottery when he crossed paths with you.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Morty, I
know I picked on your core beliefs and decision making a lot today, but I am
glad you insisted on gettin’ that fart home. You know, at least all the death
and destruction wasn’t for nothin’, you know? *notices Morty’s detached, almost
anguished expression* You miss your fart friend, huh? Well I’ve got a little
surprise for you, buddy. While you were gone I found another wormhole with
millions of beings just like him on the other side and they’re all coming to
visit.

speaker: Morty:
dialouge:
*panicking*
What?! Rick! No, you can’t!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Too
late, Morty. The hole’s opening.

dialouge:
No, no,
Rick! You don’t understand!

dialouge:
Th-there’s

Hey.

dialouge: Haha!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
*glares
at Morty* Must be nice… Hey, Morty, there’s our Jerry.

dialouge:
Mm, I
missed you. Hey, Rick.

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Glad you’re

dialouge:
I’d
like that.

*holding

dialouge:
Uh, I’m
not sure. Morty.

dialouge: What?!

speaker: Rick:
dialouge:
Way to

Uh…

dialouge: : Yeah Morty

dialouge: : Hahahahaha, yeah

dialouge: : You're excited about that?

dialouge: : Whoa!

dialouge: : Whoa!

dialouge: : One out of ten times its a deadly trap, but I'm ready to roll those dice!

dialouge: : Seems like something terrible happened here.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Yeah. Cha-ching. Oh yeah, if you find a room full of eggs, don't shy away from it, give one of them a shake. Those facehuggers are worth more than this ship.

dialouge: : Uh, what's that?

dialouge: : This will make the cops write it up as a looting by the Korblocks.

dialouge: : That's horrible!

dialouge: : I hear you man, cops are racist.

dialouge: : Oh, hey! You're alive! Thank God.

dialouge: : Can you help us? Our planet was taken over by some kind of [pauses] entity! It absorbed the minds of our people!

dialouge: : And how do you know it didn't get on the ship with you? Those two ding-dongs seem pretty calm about the whole thing.

dialouge: : Called it.

dialouge: : Oh boy. Uh, these are my grandkids, Summer and Morty. Summer, Morty, this is uh, Unity. We sort of used to, uh, date.

dialouge: : Quite an operation you got going here Une. You're a whole planet now huh?

dialouge: : then I found this world,

dialouge: : You mean stealing peoples’ bodies?

dialouge: : Summer, rude. Why don't you kids run off and play with Unity while Unity and I do some catching up.

dialouge: : Ugh.

dialouge: : I’m trying to find our weed whacker, ‘cause our weeds are wack, yo.

dialouge: : But you can’t go in the garage when Rick’s not here.

dialouge: : Well, he doesn’t like it.

dialouge: : What is that supposed to mean?

dialouge: : What the hell was that?

dialouge: : World peace achieved. Nice! A little weird to publish a paper about it for yourself, but hey. So what’s next?

dialouge: : After I become a type-one civilisation, this world will be invited into the Galactic Federation.

dialouge: : Oh, goody.

dialouge: : From there I’ll have access to countless planets and species.

dialouge: : One by one, I will unify them, I will become the universe, and I will be what the single-minded once called a god.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : [burps] I like that. Oh, that’s pretty sexy. Hey listen, where can I get a drink around here?

dialouge: : Recreational substances were phased out here. There’s no need for escape from the self when your world is one.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Unity, Unity, who am I talking to? I watched you assimilate a whole police station just to get your hands on the evidence locker.

dialouge: : Rick, when we met I was a young hivemind with the population of a small town. People… change.

speaker: Busker
dialouge: : Especially when I change them. I’m sorry to disappoint you, but… I’ve grown.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Hey, listen, I’ve grown too. I have! See, I’ve- I’ve reconnected with my family, right?

dialouge: : Hm, why is that I wonder?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Maybe it’s part of getting old. Maybe I just miss being with… a collective.

speaker: Crowd
dialouge: : Yes Rick! Yes! Yes!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh yeah!

speaker: Crowd
dialouge: : Yes! Yes!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Wait, wait, stop! H-Hold it! Not like this. We need a hang glider. And a crotchless Uncle Sam costume. And I want the entire field of your largest stadium covered end to end with naked redheads! And I want the stands packed with every man that remotely resembles my father!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Look at ‘em go! So coordinated! What’s your problem? They’re making you into a Mount Rushmore! They made burgers!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Morty, open your eyes! There is no they! These poor people’s’ bodies are being used! They’re a planet of puppets!

speaker: Fan holder
dialouge: : I can hear you.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Ugh!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Well, seems like everybody here’s cool with it. Except for all those redheads. They seem like they’re in a hurry to be somewhere else.

speaker: Clown
dialouge: : Balloon, Summer? Balloon, Morty?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : No, we don’t want your dumb balloons. We’re bored. Take us back to Rick.

speaker: Clown
dialouge: : Now’s… not a good time.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh yeah! I want youuuuuu!

speaker: Stadium
dialouge: : Go son go! Go son go! Go son go!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Oh! Real nice! Real nice! How does a man do this without me noticing?

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Oh, you know my dad. Once he puts his mind to something…

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : You’re spinning this to his credit?

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : I’m going down there.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Jerry!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Beth, this is my house, which makes this my garage, my secret hatch, my hidden subterranean lair,  and my faceless gargler. Now, are you going to keep hating this playa, or are you gonna jack my steed?

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Okay, you’re just making stuff up now.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh my god. Oh my god. [Drinks water]

speaker: Redheads
dialouge: : Oh Rick, it was so bad.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : What’s this ‘was’ stuff? I just need to hydrate and then we’re doing that again!

speaker: Redheads
dialouge: : Oh damn.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Listen, if this is an invasion I gotta sit this one out, but I’ll- I’ll be back to have sex with the survivors.

speaker: Redheads
dialouge: : It’s a neighboring hivemind species, Beta-7. Our planet’s maintained a practical alliance for exchange of vital resources. (whispering) So be nice!

speaker: Beta-7
dialouge: : Unity. [pauses] Is it a… bad time? Are all… present lifeforms… assimilated?

speaker: Man With glasses
dialouge: : Beta-7, this is my single-minded friend from Earth, Rick.

speaker: Beta-7
dialouge: : Rick… Sanchez. Unity has spoken of you.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : All bad I hope. [laughing]

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Whoa, Jesus Christ!

speaker: Redheads
dialouge: : Beta-7, if my allies are a problem for you perhaps our alliance is as well.

speaker: Beta-7
dialouge: : Our alliance is beneficial. When Beta-7 expresses concern it- it’s only … be-because…

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh snap! Powdered neutronium? Amphetetron? You know what I can make with this stuff?

speaker: Redheads
dialouge: : Oh… Rick, I- I shouldn’t...

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Come on, it’s not every day that I’m in town! It- it’s for old time’s sake.

speaker: Redheads
dialouge: : Uh… Okay, what the hell! We can purify the resin and make fractal dust!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh, I was thinking velocitinis, but…

speaker: Unity
dialouge: : Aww, old man Rick can’t party with the whole planet?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I can do whatever you do and more, baby.

speaker: Beta-7
dialouge: : Hrmm…

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : You know, I think Beta-7 over there is hoping your alliance can be more than practical.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Well, this explains the six thousand dollar electric bill.

speaker: Blim Blam
dialouge: : [Gurgling]

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Well. Nice. Real nice. Alien prisoners under the house. Real nice. Nice. Reeeal-

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Goddamn it, stop.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Wake up people! You have to fight it! You’re under the spell of an evil monster!

speaker: Man with glasses
dialouge: : I can hear you.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Yeah! So you keep saying!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Summer!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Wake up! You have to have some individuality left in there!

speaker: Steven Phillips
dialouge: : Why do you hate me, Summer?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : I’m not talking to you! I’m talking to…

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : ...Steven Phillips! Steven! Set yourself free!

speaker: Steven Phillips
dialouge: : Summer, before I took over this planet, this man was a registered sex offender.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : ...Yeah, well so what? At least he was himself.

speaker: Marine Biologist
dialouge: : This woman was a drug addict on the verge of suicide. Now she’s a marine biologist.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Listen Unity, I don’t think my sister’s trying to say that life would be perfect without you. I think she’s just saying that life would be… you know, life.

speaker: Old man
dialouge: : I have transformed life here into a paradise. Prostitutes are now scientists. The homeless are now phisosophers.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Oh, phi- phisosophers?

speaker: Old man
dialouge: : Philophiluh… phiphophibup...

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Oh my god. Where did you learn to talk you grandpa-stealing slut?

speaker: Old man
dialouge: : I’m feeling… urk!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Oh man! Let me help all of you guys up!

speaker: All
dialouge: : I’m fine!

speaker: Administrator
dialouge: : Do you know what I love about you, Rick? You’re the only single mind I’ve met who really sees the big picture.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : You got that right. But… baby, listen. Y-you’re talking about taking over planets and galaxies, you gotta… you gotta just… remember to let go sometimes, you know.

speaker: Administrator
dialouge: : I can let go! Hey, look! You see that town across the river? Watch this.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Whoa!

speaker: Administrator
dialouge: : Ha ha! Woot!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Whoa! That’s not what I meant!

speaker: Administrator
dialouge: : [laughing] It’s okay! It’s okay, I evacuated! I evacuated the town, look!

speaker: Townspeople
dialouge: : Hey! Right here! We’re fine!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : [laughing] Oh, that was awesome! My grandkids weren’t in that town, right? A-are my grandkids alive? … H-hey, my drink is empty.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: and Summer: Aah!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Unity, what’s happening?

speaker: Steven Phillips
dialouge: : Who’s Unity? You kids have nice feet. Mind if I take a picture?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Gross, no!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : I think you’re getting what you wanted, Summer. Something’s happening to Unity.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Do… all of you remember who you are?

speaker: Ron Benson
dialouge: : ...Yeah. My name is Ron Benson. I’m… an electrical engineer. Father of two, and as you can see from my flat concentric nipple rings, I’m a member of this planet’s top race! [opens shirt to reveal ring nipples]

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Okay, that’s good! Uh… Don’t focus too much on the last part, but...

speaker: Daryl Jefferson
dialouge: : I’m Daryll Jefferson. I’m a landscaper. And I’ll be damned if that ripple-nipple bitch’s race is superior! [removes shirt] The cone-nipple people will rule this world!

speaker: Ron Benson
dialouge: : You shut your mouth, you dirty knife-nipple bastards!

speaker: Daryl Jefferson
dialouge: : What’d you say to me, you target-chested piece of shit?

speaker: Alien Man
dialouge: : Race war!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Why are you fighting? Can’t you see you’re all the same?

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Ah, Summer. Ha ha. First race war, huh?

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Way to go, Summer. You started a race war.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : I didn’t start it! They’re the racists! I… I  merely empowered them to follow their apparently misguided dreams!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Okay, thanks for clarifying! Y- I’ll have a super accurate headstone now!

speaker: Rioter
dialouge: : Hey wait, what race are you guys?

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : [pulling up shirt] We’re neither! S-see?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Yeah, take my word for it. We just have regular nipples.

speaker: Rioter
dialouge: : Hey! These two freaks have no race!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Oh, there’s no place like home! There’s no place like home! Remember, Summer?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Oh…

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : From Dorothy and The Tiny People movie?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : O-oh, yes, yes yes…

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : All the tiny people?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Dorothy, take us away! Take us away!

speaker: SWAT
dialouge: : Hello Summer. Hello Morty.

speaker: Pilot
dialouge: : It’s okay! You’re safe now.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : U-Unity?

speaker: SWAT
dialouge: : Yes.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Oh, Unity I am so sorry. I didn’t know freedom meant people doing stuff that sucks! I was thinking more of… a choose-your-own-cellphone-carrier thing.

speaker: Pilot
dialouge: : Oh, Summer, you did nothing wrong! I’m having fun with your grandpa! Lost a little control. Probably shouldn’t be piloting a hovercopter, nor should I be… running two hundred thousand pediatric hospitals and twelve million deep friers, but hey! It’s not like this planet can take its business elsewhere!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Um… should we maybe stop somewhere and get you a coffee? Maybe splash a little water on your face, or…?

speaker: Pilot
dialouge: : No, no, if I wanted to be sober, I wouldn’t have gotten drunk! Wooohoooo!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Oh man. I cannot wait. I cannot wait to hear Rick explain his way around this. He is gone!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Jerry, stop! Please, okay, we weren’t even supposed to be down here. If we confront him about this-

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Oh my god! I love this! I love that this is how far you will go for him. You wanna go upstairs, and cut carrots, and watch a lifetime original, above a fucking alien dungeon! Your relationship with your father is psychotic!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Oh listen to you relish the idea that my genius father is a bad person! Step out of your ego for a second and look at this thing! It’s a monster! He might have it chained up so that it doesn’t eat the planet!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Right, because your father’s such an altruist? I once saw him briefly forget the word for humans! He’s probably harvesting this creature’s organs!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : He’s probably racing to cure its space aids!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : He’s going to eat it!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : He’s protecting it!

speaker: Blim Blam
dialouge: : [Gurgles]

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: :Shut up!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: :Shut up!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Unity! This place is a mess!

speaker: Administrator
dialouge: : Oh, it’s cool! The part of me that’s the cleaning lady is coming on Friday. [gasps] Oh my god! I have a meeting at the galactic federation in an hour. Oh, I’ll never make it! Ah, I’ll push it to next week.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Unity, could you get Rick out here please?

speaker: Administrator
dialouge: : He’s… unavailable! He’s-

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Having sex with you, we get it! Gross. Get him out here now.

speaker: Administrator
dialouge: : I don’t think he wants to be-

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : (shouting) Grandpa Rick!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : (shouting) Rick! Rick!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : (shouting) I’m gonna tell mom and dad about the gagoo you have locked up under the garage!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : What the hell… is your problem?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Grandpa, we need to go home! Now!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Fine, geez!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : See ya!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Uh, Rick? I think we should all go.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Tend your garden, kids, I’m kinda doing a thing here.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Grandpa Rick, we’re not leaving without you!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh my god [belches] you guys I get it. You’re afraid the big bad hivemind is gonna steal  your grandpa away.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Actually, no. I think Unity’s great and you’re a horrible influence on it!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : What?

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : This isn’t healthy, Rick! Y- you know you-you’re really up to no good around here. I-at-at this place,  you know?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : You and Unity are like… like… leggings and mid-calf boots. You think you’re great together but you’re just bringing out the worst in each other!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh, gee, boy Summer, well put. Uh, why don’t we see what Unity thinks. Unity?

speaker: Shades guy
dialouge: : I’m just taking a little break from stuff. You know? I need to relax.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh, hey, wh-what’s this on the news, guys? L-l-let me turn it up.

speaker: Todd
dialouge: : In the news today, this looks a lot worse than it is. We’re… really just having a good time. Karen?

speaker: Karen
dialouge: : Thanks, Todd. Up next: Are you a concerned grandchild or just a buzzkill? We’ll tell you how you can really know for sure!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I think you two are a little outnumbered.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Okay! Well, what if you did it for me? What if you came with us as a favour to us… because you love us?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : What? Dumb. Bye.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : But Rick, Summer’s just-

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Summer’s just a hyper-emotional, needy little- what’s the word I’m looking for here… uh- human! It runs in the family! I can tolerate it but I can’t give a crap about it. Take a hike.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Take care of yourself, Unity.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I’m not looking for judgement, just a yes or no. Can you assimilate a giraffe?

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : You’re the worst!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : No! You’re the worst! You don’t support this family!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : All you care about is yourself!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : You think supporting the family is about supporting you emotionally...

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : You’ve got two children being dragged across the cosmos...

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : ...but you’re unsupportable! Because it’s never enough, Jerry!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : ...by your dangerously ill father, and you force me to watch it happen!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : It will never be enough support to satisfy you! And you don’t even know what it’s like…

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Because you’d rather lose them and lose me than lose him!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : …to be afraid of losing anything because you cling and you cling and you cling…

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : And why? Because you’re the child, Beth. You, not me, you!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Aaah!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Oh my god!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: and Jerry: Aah!

speaker: Blim Blam
dialouge: : Um, first of all, hello. Uh, my name is Blim Blam the korblok. Second of all, cards on the table: I am a murderer that eats babies and I came to this planet to eat babies. However, I am also carrying a highly infectious disease, that I suppose you could call ‘space aids’ as you put it, and Rick did chain me up so that he could attempt to cure it. At the same time, Rick’s motivation to cure my disease was not to save my life or anyone else’s, but to patent and sell the cure for billions of blemflarks. But you know the reason why I ripped my chains out of the wall? And do you know why I’m never coming back to this planet? Because the two of you are the fucking worst! You both hate yourselves and each other! And the idea that it has anything to do with Rick is laughable! I’d laugh but I’m biologically incapable, that’s how alien I am! And even I’m sitting here listening to the two of you, and being like, what the fuck! So! Good luck with your shitty marriage, and I’m sorry that Rick has to deal with either of you. Blim Blam, out!

speaker: Blim Blam
dialouge: : You know what? I’m taking this.

speaker: Blim Blam
dialouge: : How do you- what is this?

speaker: Blim Blam
dialouge: : Uh, is there a slow setting? Best door ever.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Aaah! [coughs] Okay, okay, now make him cry. But happy cry. Now make ‘em all make fun of the blonde one. Now make ‘em all do it on the table! I can’t believe you created a whole show for me. Now cancel it! Okay, now put it back on. Haha! [pauses] Alright, I’m bored.

speaker: Administrator
dialouge: : Rick, is there a way for you to call Summer and Morty? I feel bad that they-

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Pfft, screw those guys! Uugh, I’ll be right back. Don’t waste your brain on those weirdos, Unity. They’re no different from any other aimless chumps that you occupy. They just put you at the centre of their lives because you’re powerful and then because they put you there they want you to be less powerful. Never gonna happen though, right?

speaker: All
dialouge: : Never.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Never! Back in a flash.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Best weekend ever, Rick! I agree, Rick! Let’s see how long we can go!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Hey Une! You got any more-

speaker: Unity (voiceover)
dialouge: : Rick, forgive me for doing this in notes. I’m not strong enough to do it in persons.

speaker: Unity (voiceover)
dialouge: : I realise now that I’m attracted to you for the same reason I can’t be with you. You can’t change. And I have no problem with that, but… it clearly means I have a problem with myself.

speaker: Unity (voiceover)
dialouge: : I’m sure there’s no perfect version of me. I’m sure I’ll just unify species after species and never really be complete.

speaker: Unity (voiceover)
dialouge: : But I know how it goes with us. I lose who I am and become part of you. Because in a strange way you’re better at what I do without even trying. Yours, and nobody else’s, Unity. P.S. I don’t know where those coal miners were before they got assimilated. You might want to get checked.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Hey.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Dad… [clears throat] I… um… Jerry and I were looking for our weed whacker, and found your subterranean lair… and your alien prisoner. And… he got away. And I know I sound like mom but I can’t sacrifice this whole family’s safety just because I’m afraid you’ll leave again, so no more alien prisoners, and, no more subterranean excavation without consulting us.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Okay.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : ...Okay? Y-y-y-y-Okay like you’re gonna quietly teleport somewhere and never come back?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : No. It’s your house.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Grandpa Rick! What happened… with Unity?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Who? Oh. Unity. Yeah, well, I mean honestly we’re talking about an entity that thrives on enslavement, you know. It’s not cool. Fun’s fun but who needs it? I’ll be in the garage.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Unity! Unity! Unity!

speaker: Beta-7
dialouge: : How can I assist you?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I wanna talk to [belches] Unity. Beta-7, I know it’s in there!

speaker: Beta-7
dialouge: : You’re classified as a hostile entity, and Unity doesn’t want to talk to you.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I know your game, Beta-7, I’ve met a billion of you, you little on-deck in-the-wind shoulder to cry on!

speaker: Beta-7
dialouge: : You are classified as a hostile entity.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Well, you’re just loving this, mother f- this isn’t gonna shape out like you think, pal! Unity’s not into other hiveminds! It’s gonna suck you in and use you up and a month from now I’m going to be making out with all of you in a bunch of red wigs! Unity! Unity! Unity, I know you can hear me! Get out here!

speaker: Beta-7
dialouge: : Weapons systems engaged.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Oh, in your dreams you have weapons systems.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Ugh, Rick, you said we were going to a movie.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : We are, Morty. Alright, Beta-shit-7, you just got saved by the bell, bitch!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Steve, I just got a weird E-mail. Did you buy us airline tickets?

speaker: Uncle Steve
dialouge: : Aw shoot, it was supposed to be a surprise! I wanted to thank you for letting me live here all this time, so I'm treating the family to a vacation!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Steve, you're so sweet!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Thanks Uncle Steve!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Best uncle ever!

speaker: Uncle Steve
dialouge: : Look out world, the Smith family is goin' to Paris!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: :(Offscreen) Yeah! Awesome!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Rick, I don't like glowing rocks in the kitchen trash.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Well I don't like your unemployed genes in my grandchildren, Jerry. But life is made of little concessions.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : I, you know what, I-

speaker: Uncle Steve
dialouge: : You're gonna land on your feet Jer. Some company out there's gonna think they're lucky stars they hired my little brother.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Who the fuck are you?

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : My goofy brother Steve. He's been living here almost a year now, are you losing your mind?

speaker: Uncle Steve
dialouge: : Hey someone's been spending too much time around glowing rocks am I right? (Everybody except Rick laughs, Rick shoots Steve in the head)

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : What the hell, Rick? What the hell?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Everybody just relax for a second. There's no such thing as an "Uncle Steve". That is an alien parasite.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : But I've known him my whole life!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : No you haven't Jerry. These telepathic little bastards, they embed themselves in memories they use those to multiply, spread out, and take over planets. It's disgusting.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Steve wasn't real?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : He's a real piece of shit! This is a big one, someone probably tracked in last week on the bottom of their shoe or on a piece of alien fruit.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Someone?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Get off the high road Summer, we all got pink eye because you won't stop texting on the toilet.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : But Uncle Steve taught me how to ride a bike.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : No, "Steve" put that memory in your brain so he could live in your house, eat your food, and multiply. We could be infested with these things, so we gotta keep an eye out for any zany, wacky characters that pop up.

speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
dialouge: : Oh wee, whatever you want Rick, we're here to help!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Thanks Mr. Poopybutthole. I always could count on you.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Alright, there's six of us and that's it. Me, Morty, Jerry, Beth, Mr. Poopybutthole, and Summer.

speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
dialouge: : Maybe you got the first one in time Rick!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Can't afford to chance it.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Dad, why does our house have blast shields?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Trust me Beth you don't wanna know how many answers that question has.

speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
dialouge: : Ooh, gosh, it feels claustrophobic! Reminds me of that time we all got stuck in the elevator together. Y-- remember that? After "the hulk" musical? (Flashback, Jerry grunting, muzak playing )

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Jerry, buttons don't work better if you hit them harder, and foam fists don't make you strong.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : I know. Friends make you strong. I watched the same musical you did.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Why couldn't I bring my portal gun? (Morty winces )

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Why did all the drinks have to be extra large? Oh, the hulk. I just got that.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Just pee your pants. I did it the minute we got stuck. Oh, oh, yeah, yeah, shame me. At least when I'm disgusting, it's on purpose.

speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
dialouge: : Oh, y'all, we're gonna be fine. I've always been here for you guys, and I always will be. ( chuckles )

speaker: Nicky
dialouge: : somebody call for repairs?

speaker: All
dialouge: : Yay! Cousin Nicky!

speaker: Nicky
dialouge: : It's me, cousin Nicky. I'm walkin' here! I mean, I'm not. I'm crouched in the elevator shaft, but hey, I'm walkin' here! ( laughter ) (Cut back to the present) It's true. We really do get into some crazy situations as a family, mostly when we're cooped up like this. Hey, maybe Mr. Poopypants is right. L-let's get some fresh air.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Come on, cousin Nicky. You heard Rick. We have to stay quarantined until we know that there's no more of these things.

speaker: Nicky
dialouge: : I hear you, Morty. Back in brooklyn, we got a sayin' -- "we're walkin' here!" ( laughter )

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Nicky! (Rick shoots Nicky in the shoulder, and he reverts back into a parasite)

speaker: Nicky
dialouge: : Oh! ( gasps ) ( groaning )

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : What the...? Cousin Nicky was a parasite?!

speaker: Rick

dialouge: : Stay back! This watch turns people into snakes!

dialouge: : Stand down. Everybody stand down! I’m the leader of these people and I’m unarmed. There’s no need for any more snake-makery.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : My name is Rick Sanchez. This here’s my grandson Morty. (drinks from flask)

speaker: Everyone
dialouge: : Hi, Morty.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Hey.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I’ve seen enough of the galaxy to know that what we’ve got here is a Cromulon from the Cygnus-5 Expanse. So you can forget about nukes, and you can forget about math. (points to viewscreen showing floating head) This head won’t go away until *burp* Earth shows them it’s got a hit song.

speaker: Everyone
dialouge: : Seriously, that’s impossible, etc…

speaker: Simon
dialouge: : You mean like Vivaldi?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : No, Frasier. A live performance of a newly-written, catchy, original song. The Cromulon feed on the talent and showmanship of less-evolved lifeforms.

speaker: President
dialouge: : All right, all right. Thank you, Mr. Sanchez. Change of plan, people. Get me Pharrell, Randy Newman, Billy Corgan, and The-Dream. (no one responds) The-Dream? He wrote “Umbrella” and “Single Ladies”? You people haven’t heard of The-Dream?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : You’re gonna wanna put them on that giant speaker system at your sonic testing facility at Area 51.

speaker: Nathan
dialouge: : How do you know about that?

speaker: President
dialouge: : For God’s sake, Nathan, the man turns people into snakes. He can use Google Maps.

speaker: Aide
dialouge: : Sir! Pharrell, Newman, Corgan, and that Dream guy. They’re all dead.

speaker: President
dialouge: : What? How is that possible? Do people just die when I name them?

speaker: Aide
dialouge: : The Grammys, sir. There was an earthquake and all the musicians... (sniffs, holding back tears) All the famous ones, they’re gone.

speaker: President
dialouge: : Dear God.

speaker: Aide
dialouge: : Hold on, sir, just a minute. Ice-T survived. He’s inbound on an F-15, ETA two hours.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Good luck, Mr. President.

speaker: Simon
dialouge: : Sir, the magnetic poles are about to reverse. In two hours, there may not be an Earth to save.

speaker: President
dialouge: : Sanchez! Are you a musician?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I dabble, Mr. President.

speaker: President
dialouge: : Get this man and his grandson on a Blackhawk to Area 51.

speaker: Pastor Bob
dialouge: : People! Everyone! Remain calm! Every crisis of faith is an opportunity for more faith! When God deals you an 11, you don’t fold! You double down, and always hit on a soft 16. That means you, Jews.

speaker: Jew
dialouge: : I beg your pardon, pastor, but the last I looked outside, it seems to be you that’s been dealt the weak hand. Jews rule! (no one responds) Nobody? Ok, tough church.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Hi, Principal Vagina. The name’s real, possibly Scandinavian. I’m just gonna come out and make this pitch. The old gods are dead. F*** all previous existing religions. All hail the one true god, the giant head in the sky.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Ah, di di di di. (to Bob) Bob, Bob, I get it. But unless this (holds up a necklace with a cross) can beat that… what have you done for me lately? (tosses necklace to Bob) So if you wanna excuse me, I’m going out on the sidewalk and dropping to my knees and pledging my eternal soul to the thing that literally controls the f***ing weather! (walks out) Outta my way!

speaker: Pastor Bob
dialouge: : Ok, if sanity’s been restored to this assembly, I’d like to talk about the cost of repairing our new organ. Sally, the plate, please.

speaker: Mr. Goldenfold
dialouge: : (holds up a dollar) Ohhhh, this is my favorite part!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Rick, are you really a musician?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Who’s NOT a musician, Morty?

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Me!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Yeah, not with that attitude.

speaker: Jump Master
dialouge: We’re in the drop zone! I’m the jump master! My name’s Jamey! With an E-Y! Go, go, go! (Rick slides down rope)

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : B-b-but we don’t have a song!

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Giant head in the sky, please forgive all that we’ve done. We’re sorry for increased levels of emissions and our racism. And of course, the amber alerts I keep ignoring on my phone.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : WhooooOOOOAHHHH!!!!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : WhooooOOOOAHHHH!!!!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : (picks up a microphone) All right, Morty, let’s get ready to do it! Why don’t you, uh, find a button on one of those keyboards and lay down some kind of beat?

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Rick, I think we need to cut our losses. We get our family and portal out of here!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Morty! Good music comes from people who are relaxed. Just hit a button, Morty! Gimme a beat!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Oh man, ok, all right, um…

speaker: Rick
dialouge:
: Ahhhhh yeahhhhh

Ya gotta get schwifty

(Morty starts beating a tambourine in rhythm)

Ya gotta get schwifty in here

It’s time to get schwifty

speaker: Nathan
dialouge: : Get… schwifty? What the hell is that?

speaker: President
dialouge: : It’s our world’s best effort, that’s what.

speaker: Rick
dialouge:
: Take off your pants and your panties

Shit on the floor

Time to get schwifty in here

I’m Mr. Bulldops

dialouge: : Mr. Bulldops?

speaker: President
dialouge: : Don’t analyze it, Nathan. It’s working!

speaker: Rick
dialouge:
: Take a shit on the floor

Time to get schwifty in here

speaker: Pastor Bob
dialouge: : And third-level donors get our all access family pass.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Listen! The storm is stopping!

speaker: Rick
dialouge:
: Hey, take your pants off

It’s schwifty time today

speaker: Giant Head
dialouge: : Hmmmm.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Please be kind to us for we are but tiny things with entire bodies stuck to your ground.

speaker: Giant Head
dialouge: : I LIKE WHAT YOU GOT. GOOD JOB.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Now hold on a second, let’s be rational about this.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : No, I’m… I’m just saying, we don’t know if there’s a cause-effect relationship --

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Oh, God, what’s going on now?

speaker: President
dialouge: : What the hell happened?

speaker: Aide
dialouge: : Mr. President, you’re gonna wanna see this.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I think planet Earth has just been transported.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: The head has left and sent its children!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Holy CRAP!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Oh dear giant head, we apologize for that discussion! It will never happen again!

speaker: Simon
dialouge: : Sir, we’ve started picking up on a garbled signal. We’re decrypting it now.

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: WE ASKED THEM TO SHOW US WHAT THEY GOT. AND THEY DID. NOW WE’LL SEE WHICH OF THEM HAS GOT THE MOST. 24 HOURS, FIVE PLANETS, FIVE SONGS. BUT IN THE END, THERE CAN ONLY BE ONE. PLANET MUSIC! All participation is involuntary. Disqualified and losing planets are disintegrated by plasma ray.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Uhh, it’s probably a bad time to mention it, but any astronauts you guys had in orbit are definitely dead.

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: Welcome back to Planet Music! First up, let’s hear the latest song from planet Parblesnops. The Greebybobes! SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT.

speaker: Greebybobe
dialouge: Hold it, hold it, stop! Music isn’t about competition or captivity! If you love music, you love freedom. Let these worlds be free, please!

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: DISQUALIFIED!

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: There’s one every season. Moving on to planet Arbolez Meterosos. Arbolian Meterososians. SHOW US WHAT YOU GOT.

speaker: Arbolian Meterososian
dialouge: Ah two, three, four…

speaker: Aide
dialouge: : Rick, Morty, Ice-T. The timetable’s moved up. Earth’s on in six hours.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Like we’re not already under enough pressure! (Morty flips a bowl of peanuts at the aide and it hits him in the head. The aide leaves.)

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Whoa ho ho ho ho!

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: : Whoa ho ho ho ho!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Geez, Morty. The guy’s just doing his job. Take it easy.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Rick, Ice-T, could you guys take it less easy?! We’ve got six hours to come up with a song!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Genius happens in the moment, Morty. (walks over to keyboard)

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Well, can we at least go get our family? You know, so we can take them with-with-with us if we lose?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : That’s planning for failure, Morty. Even dumber than regular planning. (presses a button on the keyboard) Balls.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Morty, Morty, stop! Listen! There’s only so much charge left in this thing. If we portal home from here and back, we’re not gonna have enough charge left to get off-world. Get it?

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : What?!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Yeah, *burp* you see, I try to shelter you from certain realities, *burp* Morty. Cause if I let you make me nervous, then we can’t get schwifty.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Stop saying it like it’s a thing! You made it up!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Hey, Morty! Could you lick my… (Rick presses keys on the keyboard with the sample of him saying “Balls”)

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Rick, cut it out! That’s not funny, Rick!

speaker: Nathan
dialouge: : I’ve seen enough. These guys are one-hit wonders.

speaker: President
dialouge: : And what’s your plan, General?

speaker: Nathan
dialouge: : We still have the nuclear option. On my word, we can launch a nuclear missile at every one of those heads in the sky.

speaker: President
dialouge: : Our planet’s held captive on a live game show and your solution is to shoot the audience? You can put your faith in nukes if we get through this, General. Until then, I’ll put mine in Rick and Morty. “Get Schwifty” was a jam.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Hello? Yes sir, yeah. Thank you sir, thank you. He says he’s proud of what we’re doing and hopes we have a great Ascension Festival! Happy Ascension!

speaker: All
dialouge: Happy Ascension!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : We should pack up and leave town now.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : I think it’s inspiring that our community is coping with fear in a way that involves a festival and homemade ice cream. If you’d stop being such an evangelical atheist, you might start enjoying yourself.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Whoa! Look at you! You’re wearing the hat and everything!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Here’s yours! (puts hat on Jerry) Mom, do you mind if I cook dinner tonight?

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Yeah, sure. Wait, what??

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : I love you guys. You gave me life. And it’s the will of the many heads that all children honor their parents.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Dinner sounds nice.

speaker: Ethan
dialouge: Pardon, Mr. and Mrs. Smith. Summer, are you coming to the Ascension?

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Father, can we please go to the Ascension?

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Sure! Let’s go to the Ascension. Wh-wh-what is it?

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: We hereby send these un-wantables skyward that they might be inhaled by the many heads, later to be sneezed back to us as better babies! (cuts first rope) Headward, free now to rise. (cuts second rope) Headward, free now to rise. (cuts third rope) Headward, free now to rise.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Oh yes, yes! Rise to the giant head! You are free to be free!

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: A squeegee comes up from the garage, right? And he’s got a lobster in one hand and movie tickets in the other. He’s like, “I’m ready!”

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Who would take a lobster to see Iron Man 3?

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Aw, damn. We’re out of original flavor Fig Newtons. I should get going anyway.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Wait, wait, wait! Come on, h-hold on a second!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : What?!

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Damn. You didn’t tell me you f*** around with portals and shit.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : That’s it!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Whoa, whoa! Morty! Give me that!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : You lied! You lied about the charge! You were just being lazy! Get back! Sit down!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Morty, just put it down. You don’t know what you’re doing.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : I’m going to go find Mom and Dad.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Nooooo!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Ahhhh, sh**!

speaker: President
dialouge: : Ah, sh**.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Ahhh, sh**.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : And then Ethan played guitar and we learned the Seven Contemplations of the Head by singing them. It was really fun. Praise be the head!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Praise be the…

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Praise be the…

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Yeah.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Hi folks, Head Priest Vagina. Thanks for farming all those potatoes. It’s 6 p.m., so if you’re a parent, you’re now entitled to adoration from your children.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : I’m going to start dinner! (walks into the house)

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : I don’t know what to say. Summer is doing really well here.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : She’s aced every test in potato class, and look how important potatoes have become.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : She’s not getting pregnant or doing drugs or missing curfew…

speaker: Balloon Man
dialouge: : Please help me! You can reach me if you try. Please help me!!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : That’s not our business as long as Summer is thriving!

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Taco time! (Summer pulls off the lid to reveal exactly 12 tacos.) I hope it pleases you as the head desires.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : That’s wonderful, Summer!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : We’re so proud of you. But honestly, you don’t have to make dinner every night.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : Of course I do, silly! (gasps and drops lid) Oh my God, daddy, I’m sorry I called you silly! I’m so sorry! (turns around and drops to knees) Heavenly head and cranial creator! Forgive my transgressions against family and community! May my chores complete me as I complete them!

speaker: Birdperson
dialouge: : Morty.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Birdperson?

speaker: Birdperson
dialouge: : You appear to be dying. I will make efforts to prevent this, but can promise nothing.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Wh-What do you think, Ice? Probably a little over-developed.

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Shit. Over-developed, under-developed. Bad songs are bad songs.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Well, do you think maybe, could you give me some help with it, or… ?

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Ah, hell no, man. You do your thing, but I can’t afford to get my pride wrapped up in your shame. You know what I’m sayin’?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Ice, I don’t want to be a negative Nelly or anything, but *burp* if Morty doesn’t come back with my portal gun and I eat it out there, it’s, uh, kind of your problem too.

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Pfff. I ain’t worried about no Earth blowin’ up, man.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : What? Why not?

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Yo, this is why.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : What the f***? You can turn into ice?

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: My story begins at the dawn of time in the far away realm of Alphabetrium. There, every being is a letter of the alphabet. But I was frozen and exiled to the cosmos by my elders as punishment for not caring enough about anything. Earth is just one of the many stops on my lifelong journey with no destination. So you better believe I don’t care if it blows up! Cause I’ll just be ice, floatin’ through space, like a comet!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Take it from me, Ice. *burp* You can’t just *burp* float around space not caring about stuff forever.

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Pshhhh. Man, watch me. Good luck, Rick.

speaker: President
dialouge: : Ok, things are getting out of hand. I better make sure Rick has everything he needs to “get schwifty.”

speaker: Nathan
dialouge: : Oh, for God’s sake, that’s enough.

speaker: President
dialouge: : What the hell are you doing, Nathan? I’m the goddamn President of the United f***in’ States!

speaker: Nathan
dialouge: : I’m setting the nuclear option to launch one minute into Earth’s performance. And you, Mr. President, I hope you like being hit in the face with a gun!

speaker: President
dialouge: : Wait, wait, wait, why-why --

speaker: Birdperson
dialouge: : I believe I can access the history of Rick’s gun and help you get back to him.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : But can you help me get to my family? You know, at my house?

speaker: Birdperson
dialouge: : Is your intention to abandon Rick using his own portal gun? In bird culture, this is considered a dick move.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : All of Rick’s moves are dick moves! Wh-what am I eating? What is this, bird seed?

speaker: Birdperson
dialouge: : It is random debris. I found it in my carpet. I don’t know what humans eat.

speaker: Tammy
dialouge: : You know what THIS human eats!

speaker: Birdperson
dialouge: : Don’t be gross, Tammy.

speaker: Tammy
dialouge: : (leans over to Morty and whispers) Bird… d***.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Tammy… gross. Birdperson, you always stick up for Rick, but he doesn’t care about anyone but himself. He doesn’t think about the consequences of anything he does.

speaker: Birdperson
dialouge: : And as a result, he has the power to save or destroy entire worlds. And he is the reason you and I know each other. And the reason I’m alive at all.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : What’s that? Who’s that baby?

speaker: Birdperson
dialouge: : Morty, suppose you could retrieve your family from Earth but had to abandon Rick. I could give your loved ones shelter on Birdworld, even jobs, possibly as worm ranchers. How often do you think you might look up at the stars and wonder what might have been had you just put your faith in Rick?

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: That was Chunky Tunk with “Full Ming Mong, Empty Gorp Dorp.” Up next, planet Earth!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Oh God! We’re up?!?!

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Jerry and Beth, your family is a golden example of what Headism has to offer the world.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : The world?

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Headism is a hit. We’re taking it worldwide and would like Jerry to be our church’s “Head” of Advertising.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : You… would?

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Beth, we’d like to promote you from horse surgeon, straight past human surgeon, to “Head” of Medicine.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : That’s my dream! That’s my dream.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Thank you. This is all so overwhelming, but, uh… we can’t.

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Absolutely not.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: I’m sorry?

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : We’ve been waiting 16 years for our daughter to respect us, but the key is, it has to be “our” daughter, not this person she’s become.

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : We’ll take our chances raising her without fancy new jobs outside of a potato-based religion. (turns and puts his hands on Beth’s shoulders) And you know what? I’m sick of pretending that we’re together because of the kids in the first place! I married you because you’re the love of my life!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : (puts her hands on Jerry’s sides) And I‘m lucky to have you and I never tell you that! You know, we will come out of this stronger as a family!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : Please don’t do this, please don’t do this! Summer!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Summer, listen carefully. I stole a paper clip and I have it in my cheek but I don’t know what to do with it and it hurts.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : You’re going to be ok! (ties another balloon to them) You will come back as babies!

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : I AM a baby! I’m a baby NOW!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Hello? Is anybody here? (looks through the studio window and sees the President tied up) Mr. President!

speaker: President
dialouge: : This is Bluebird. Code tango-niner-alpha. Abort launch. Abort! Hello? (releases button) He’s blocked me out.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Sir, I need to get to the stage and help Rick get schwifty!

speaker: President
dialouge: : It won’t matter how schwifty you get, Morty. The General’s got nukes set to launch halfway through Earth’s song!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Oh my God! C-c-can you fly a Blackhawk?

speaker: President
dialouge: : Can the Pope’s d*** fit through a donut?

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Uhhh, I’m not sure?

speaker: President
dialouge: : Exactly!

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT.

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Ahem. (starts a low-key, bouncy song) Uhhh… lop-oo-lop-oo-lop-oo-dups, nop-oo-nop-oo-nop-oo-nuts.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Headward free now to rise!

speaker: Mr. Goldenfold
dialouge: : Hey! Look at the heads! Looks like the heads are gettin’ angry!

speaker: President
dialouge: : I’m really bad at this, Morty! There are way too many buttons on this thing!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Mr. President, if I’ve learned one thing today, it’s that sometimes, you have to not give a f***!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Nup-oo-nup-oo-nup-oo-nups… ooh, tough crowd.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: I’m sure that has… that has nothing to do with this.

speaker: Summer
dialouge: : The heads are displeased! (She jumps and grabs Beth and Jerry’s legs.)

speaker: Ethan
dialouge: Summer! (He jumps and grabs her.)

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Morty!

speaker: Mr. Goldenfold
dialouge: : The heads love this! They love it when we DON’T kill the Smith family!

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: No! Stop that! You’re not allowed to interpret the will of the heads!

speaker: President
dialouge: : Call off the nuclear strike! This is the President. Stop the nuclear missile launch!

speaker: Nathan
dialouge: : Just launch the missiles!

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: BOO! NOT COOL!

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: I’m the only one that speaks to the heads!

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: DISQUALIFIED!

speaker: Mr. Goldenfold
dialouge: : The heads disqualified Vagina! Get him!

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: DISQUALIFIED! DISQUALIFIED!

speaker: All
dialouge: Ice-T?

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: That’s right, it’s me, Ice-T! I care now! You made me care more! With all due respect, I’d like to hear what Rick and Morty have to play.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : What do you say, Rick?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : I say… (grabs mic) Let’s do it!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : All right!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Ohhhh yeahhhh!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Come on, here we go!

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Ohhhh yeahhhh!

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Say it with me!

speaker: All
dialouge:
Head bent over

Raised up posterior

Head bent over (ahh yeah)

Raised up posterior

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: Ohhh my GOOOOODDDD!!!

speaker: All
dialouge:
Head bent over (yeah)

Raised up posterior (oh yeah)

Head bent over (oh yeah)

(Raised up posterior!)

speaker: Cromulon
dialouge: After 988 seasons of Planet Music, the Cromulons have decided to declare Earth the final winner and bring our musical reality show to a conclusion. Goodbye!

speaker: All
dialouge: Yeah, we did it!

speaker: Mr. Goldenfold
dialouge: : Did he just say “musical reality show”?

speaker: Jerry
dialouge: : Yeah, it’s possible that we may have been correlating some things that weren’t actually related at all.

speaker: Principal Vagina
dialouge: HEEEEELLLLPPPP!!!!!

speaker: Beth
dialouge: : We should go get him.

speaker: President
dialouge: : I hope I can call on you again if we need you, Morty.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Sure thing! And I was kinda hoping that I could get a selfie with you?

speaker: President
dialouge: : Actually, if you try to tell anyone what happened here, we’ll deny it and probably worse.

speaker: Morty
dialouge: : Understood.

speaker: Nathan
dialouge: : DIIIIEEEE!!!!

speaker: President
dialouge: : Why didn’t he turn into a snake?

speaker: Rick
dialouge: : Trade secret, Mr. President. Particle beam in a wristwatch… snake holster on the leg.

speaker: President
dialouge: : I love this man!

speaker: Ice-T
dialouge: Magnesium-J, Hydrogen-F. Father.

speaker: Magnesium-J
dialouge: : Word of your selfless acts on the Earth planet have travelled across the galaxy.

And I think it's because the only truly unapproachable concept for you is that it's your mind within your control.
You chose to come here, you chose to talk to belittle my vocation, just as you chose to become a pickle.
You are the master of your universe, and yet you are dripping with rat blood and feces.
Your enormous mind literally vegetating by your own hand.
I have no doubt that you would be bored senseless by therapy, the same way I'm bored when I brush my teeth and wipe my ass.
Because the thing about repairing, maintaining, and cleaning is it's not an adventure.
